org.lightsleep

Class Sql<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lightsleep.Sql<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the entity class corresponding to the main table
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    SqlEntityInfo<E>

    public class Sql<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements SqlEntityInfo<E>
    The class to build and execute SQLs.
    Example
     List<Contact> contacts = new ArrayList<>();
 Transaction.execute(connection -> {
     new Sql<>(Contact.class)
         .where("{familyName} = {}", "Apple")
         .select(connection, contacts::add);
 });
    SQL
     SELECT id, familyName, givenName, ... FROM Contact WHERE familyName='Apple'
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Masato Kokubo

      If the WHERE condition is not specified, dose not delete.

      • columns

        public Sql<E> columns(java.lang.String... columns)
        Specifies the columns for SELECT SQL. Specify the property names that related to the columns. You can also be specified "*" or "<table alias>.*". If this method is not called it will be in the same manner as "*" is specified.
        Example
             new Sql<>(Contact.class)
         .columns("familyName", "givenName")
        Example
             new Sql<>(Contact.class, "C")
         .innerJoin(Phone.class, "P", "{P.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .columns("C.id", "P.*")
         .select(connection, contacts::add);
        Parameters:
        columns - the array of the property names related to the columns
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if columns or any of columns is null

      • getColumns

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getColumns()
        Returns the columns for SELECT SQL.
        Returns:
        a set of the specified property names in columns method

      • expression

        public Sql<E> expression(java.lang.String propertyName,
                         Expression expression)
        Associates expression to the column related to propertyName.
        If expression is empty, releases the previous association of propertyName.
        Example
             new Sql<>(Contact.class)
         .expression("birthday", "'['||{birthday}||']'")
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property name
        expression - the expression
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if propertyName or expression is null

        public <JE> Sql<E> innerJoin(java.lang.Class<JE> entityClass,
                             java.lang.String tableAlias,
                             Condition on)
        Add an information of the table that join with INNER JOIN.
        Example
             new Sql<>(Contact.class)
         .innerJoin(Phone.class, "P", "{P.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .select(connection, contacts::add, phones::add);

        tableAlias - the alias of the table to join

      • where

        public Sql<E> where(E entity)
        Specifies the WHERE condition by EntityCondition.
        Example
             Contact contact = new Contact();
     contact.familyName = "Apple";
     contact.givenName = "Yukari";
     new Sql<>(Contact.class, "C")
         .where(contact)
         .select(connection, contacts::add);
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity of the EntityCondition
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if entity is null

      • where

        public <SE> Sql<E> where(java.lang.String content,
                         Sql<SE> subSql)
        Specifies the WHERE condition by SubqueryCondition.
        Example
             new Sql<>(Contact.class, "C")
         .where("EXISTS",
              new Sql<>(Phone.class, "P")
                  .where("{P.contactId} = {C.id}")
                  .and("{P.phoneNumber} LIKE {}", "080%")
         )
         .select(connection, contacts::add);
        Type Parameters:
        SE - the entity class of the subquery
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the SubqueryCondition
        subSql - the Sql object of the SubqueryCondition
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if content or subSql is null

      • and

        public Sql<E> and(Condition condition)
        If after you call having method, add the condition to the HAVING condition useing AND. Otherwise, add the condition to the WHERE condition.
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if condition is null

      • and

        public Sql<E> and(java.lang.String content,
                  java.lang.Object... arguments)
        If after you call having method, add the Expression condition to the HAVING condition useing AND. Otherwise, add the condition to the WHERE condition.
        Example
             new Sql<>(Contact.class, "C")
         .where("{familyName} = {}", "Apple")
         .and("{givenName} = {}", "Akiyo")
         .select(connection, contacts::add);
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the Expression
        arguments - the arguments of the Expression
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if content or arguments is null

      • and

        public <SE> Sql<E> and(java.lang.String content,
                       Sql<SE> subSql)
        If after you call having method, add a SubqueryCondition condition to the HAVING condition useing AND. Otherwise, add the condition to the WHERE condition.
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        content - the content of the SubqueryCondition
        subSql - the Sql object of the SubqueryCondition
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • or

        public Sql<E> or(java.lang.String content,
                 java.lang.Object... arguments)
        If after you call having method, add the Expression condition to the HAVING condition useing OR. Otherwise, add the condition to the WHERE condition.
        Example
             new Sql<>(Contact.class, "C")
         .where("{familyName}", "Apple")
         .or("{familyName}", "Orange")
         .select(connection, contacts::add);
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the Expression
        arguments - the arguments of the Expression
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if content or arguments is null

      • having

        public Sql<E> having(Condition condition)
        Specifies the HAVING condition.

        Throws:

      • select

        public void select(java.sql.Connection connection,
                   java.util.function.Consumer<? super E> consumer)
        Generates and executes a SELECT SQL that joins no tables.
        Example
             List<Contact> contacts = new ArrayList<>();
     new Sql<>(Contact.class, "C")
         .select(connection, contacts::add);
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        consumer - a consumer for the entities
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection or consumer is null
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception

      • select

        public <JE1> void select(java.sql.Connection connection,
                         java.util.function.Consumer<? super E> consumer,
                         java.util.function.Consumer<? super JE1> consumer1)
        Generates and executes a SELECT SQL that joins one table.
        Example
             List<Contact> contacts = new ArrayList<>();
     List<Phone> phones = new ArrayList<>();
     new Sql<>(Contact.class, "C")
         .innerJoin(Phone.class, "P", "{P.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .select(connection, contacts::add, phones:add);
        Type Parameters:
        JE1 - the entity class of the joined table
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        consumer - a consumer for the entities of the main table
        consumer1 - a consumer for the entities of the joined table
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection, consumer or consumer1 is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if joinInfo information is less than 1
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception

      • select

        public <JE1,JE2> void select(java.sql.Connection connection,
                             java.util.function.Consumer<? super E> consumer,
                             java.util.function.Consumer<? super JE1> consumer1,
                             java.util.function.Consumer<? super JE2> consumer2)
        Generates and executes a SELECT SQL that joins two tables.
        Example
             List<Contact> contacts = new ArrayList<>();
     List<Phone> phones = new ArrayList<>();
     List<Email> emails = new ArrayList<>();
     new Sql<>(Contact.class, "C")
         .innerJoin(Phone.class, "P", "{P.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .innerJoin(Email.class, "E", "{E.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .select(connection, contacts::add, phones:add, emails::add);
        Type Parameters:
        JE1 - the entity class of the 1st joined table
        JE2 - the entity class of the 2nd joined table
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        consumer - a consumer for the entities of the main table
        consumer1 - a consumer for the entities of the 1st join table
        consumer2 - a consumer for the entities of the 2nd join table
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection, consumer, consumer1 or consumer2 is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if join information is less than 2
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception

      • select

        public <JE1,JE2,JE3> void select(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                 java.util.function.Consumer<? super E> consumer,
                                 java.util.function.Consumer<? super JE1> consumer1,
                                 java.util.function.Consumer<? super JE2> consumer2,
                                 java.util.function.Consumer<? super JE3> consumer3)
        Generates and executes a SELECT SQL that joins three tables.
        Example
             List<Contact> contacts = new ArrayList<>();
     List<Phone> phones = new ArrayList<>();
     List<Email> emails = new ArrayList<>();
     List<Address> addresses = new ArrayList<>();
     new Sql<>(Contact.class, "C")
         .innerJoin(Phone.class, "P", "{P.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .innerJoin(Email.class, "E", "{E.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .innerJoin(Address.class, "A", "{A.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .select(connection, contacts::add, phones:add, emails::add, addresses::add);
        Type Parameters:
        JE1 - the entity class of the 1st joined table
        JE2 - the entity class of the 2nd joined table
        JE3 - the entity class of the 3rd joined table
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        consumer - a consumer for the entities of the main table
        consumer1 - a consumer for the entities of the 1st join table
        consumer2 - a consumer for the entities of the 2nd join table
        consumer3 - a consumer for the entities of the 3rd join table
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection, consumer, consumer1, consumer2 or consumer3 is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if join information is less than 3
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception

      • select

        public <JE1,JE2,JE3,JE4> void select(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                     java.util.function.Consumer<? super E> consumer,
                                     java.util.function.Consumer<? super JE1> consumer1,
                                     java.util.function.Consumer<? super JE2> consumer2,
                                     java.util.function.Consumer<? super JE3> consumer3,
                                     java.util.function.Consumer<? super JE4> consumer4)
        Generates and executes a SELECT SQL that joins four tables.
        Example
             List<Contact> contacts = new ArrayList<>();
     List<Phone> phones = new ArrayList<>();
     List<Email> emails = new ArrayList<>();
     List<Address> addresses = new ArrayList<>();
     List<Url> urls = new ArrayList<>();
     new Sql<>(Contact.class, "C")
         .innerJoin(Phone.class, "P", "{P.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .innerJoin(Email.class, "E", "{E.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .innerJoin(Address.class, "A", "{A.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .innerJoin(Url.class, "U", "{U.contactId} = {C.id}")
         .select(connection, contacts::add, phones:add, emails::add, addresses::add urls::add);
        Type Parameters:
        JE1 - the entity class of the 1st joined table
        JE2 - the entity class of the 2nd joined table
        JE3 - the entity class of the 3rd joined table
        JE4 - the entity class of the 4th joined table
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        consumer - a consumer for the entities of the main table
        consumer1 - a consumer for the entities of the 1st join table
        consumer2 - a consumer for the entities of the 2nd join table
        consumer3 - a consumer for the entities of the 3rd join table
        consumer4 - a consumer for the entities of the 4th join table
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection, consumer, consumer1, consumer2, consumer3 or consumer4 is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if join information is less than 4
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception

      • select

        public java.util.Optional<E> select(java.sql.Connection connection)
        Generates and executes a SELECT SQL and returns an Optional of the entity if searched, Optional.empty() otherwise.
        Example
             Contact contact = new Sql<>(Contact.class)
         .where("{id} = ", contactId)
         .select(connection).orElse(null);
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        Returns:
        an Optional of the entity if searched, Optional.empty() otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection is null
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception
        ManyRowsException - if more than one row searched

        public int selectCount(java.sql.Connection connection)

         .selectCount(connection);

        Returns:
        the row count
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection is null
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception

      • insert

        public int insert(java.sql.Connection connection,
                  java.lang.Iterable<? extends E> entities)
        Generates and executes INSERT SQLs for each element of entities.
        Example
             List<Contact> contacts = new ArrayList<>();
       ...
     int count = new Sql<>(Contact.class)
         .insert(connection, contacts);
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        entities - an Iterable of entities
        Returns:
        the row count
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection, entities or any element of entities is null
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception

      • update

        public int update(java.sql.Connection connection,
                  E entity)
        Generates and executes an UPDATE SQL.
        If the WHERE condition is specified, updates by the condition.
        To update all rows of the target table, specify Condition.ALL to WHERE conditions.
        Example
             Contact contact = new Contact();
       ...
     int count = new Sql<>(Contact.class)
         .update(connection, contact);
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        entity - the entity to be updated
        Returns:
        the row count
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection or entity is null
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception

      • update

        public int update(java.sql.Connection connection,
                  java.lang.Iterable<? extends E> entities)
        Generates and executes UPDATE SQLs for each element of entities.
        Even if the WHERE condition is specified, new EntityCondition(entity) will be specified for each entity.
        Example
             List<Contact> contacts = new ArrayList<>();
       ...
     int count = new Sql<>(Contact.class)
         .update(connection, contacts);
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        entities - an Iterable of entities
        Returns:
        the row count
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection, entities or any element of entities is null
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception

      • delete

        public int delete(java.sql.Connection connection)
        Generates and executes a DELETE SQL.
        If the WHERE condition is not specified, dose not delete.
        To delete all rows of the target table, specify Condition.ALL to WHERE conditions.
        Example
             int count = new Sql<>(Contact.class)
         .where(Condition.ALL)
         .delete(connection);
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        Returns:
        the row count
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection is null
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception
